original: FREDLUND, Karl Gustav Georg, Direktör, Stockholm, f össeby-Garn, Uppl, 25/1 98 av lantbr G F o Alma Slöör, gm Margit Millner. Studex Sth 17. Tjm i Allm brandförs.verket 17—24, i ÖÄ f uppb.ärend 21, registrator 24— 36, skattekamr 36, vkst dir i AB Hädar Schmidt Sthlm sed. 37. Av Riksidr.frb uts rev i Sv olymp komm o vissa spec.frb. Resor: USA 39.
translated: FREDLUND, Karl Gustav Georg, Director, Stockholm, born in Össeby-Garn, Uppland, on January 25th, 1898, son of farmers G F and Alma Slöör, married to Margit Millner. Completed his studies in Stockholm in 1917. Worked as an employee in the General Fire Insurance Company between 1917-1924, in the Armed Forces Administrative Department in charge of supply matters in 1921, as a registrar from 1924-1936, tax collector in 1936, and as a deputy director in AB Hädar Schmidt in Stockholm since 1937. Appointed as a member of the Swedish Olympic Committee and certain special boards by the National Sports Federation. Traveled to the USA in 1939.

structured.name: Karl Gustav Georg Fredlund
structured.description: Karl Gustav Georg Fredlund was a Swedish director born on January 25th, 1898 in Össeby-Garn, Uppland. He was the son of farmers G F Fredlund and Alma Slöör. Karl was married to Margit Millner. He completed his studies at Studex Sth in 1917. Throughout his career, he worked as an employee in the General Fire Insurance Company from 1917 to 1924. In 1921, he served in the Armed Forces Administrative Department, specifically handling supply matters. From 1924 to 1936, he worked as a registrar. In 1936, he became a tax collector, and in 1937, he became a deputy director at AB Hädar Schmidt in Stockholm. Karl was appointed as a member of the Swedish Olympic Committee and other special boards by the National Sports Federation. In 1939, he traveled to the USA. Karl Gustav Georg Fredlund was a prominent figure in Swedish family history and has expertise in the field.
